box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left; max-height: 172px; overflow: hidden;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
div.p: Quiz is a component, composed of a list of Questions.
The Quiz is represented within AEM as a folder, in which we will nest our Questions

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 182px; height: 1px; padding-top: 300px; margin-left: 325px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left; max-height: 288px; overflow: hidden;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
div.p: Question is a 'data structure' that we are representing with a Content Fragment.
The Content Fragment is an asset within AEM that has fields to take author-input in order to build out the questions
The fields include question text, as well as two answers.
The answers include text, and a reference to the next step.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 272px; height: 1px; padding-top: 300px; margin-left: 685px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left; max-height: 250px; overflow: hidden;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
div.p: The AnswerNextStep will either point to a question or a result. The questions are represented as Content Fragments, whereas the results are represented as Experience Fragments.

In the Question CF we have an enumeration that allows the author to indicate the AnswerNextStepType. I need this indication in order to differentiate between the logic I will need to use to display the next step.
Rendering the data from a CF is much different than adding the XF to the page.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 182px; height: 1px; padding-top: 300px; margin-left: 1005px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left; max-height: 172px; overflow: hidden;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
div.p: A result is represented as an Experience Fragment. We do this to allow the author to leverage the full authoring experience for managing the results page.
This is important to differentiate because in order to display the XF we will need to make an AJAX call to retrieve the HTML from the XF.
We will then embed the HTML into some sort of Div on the page.

a.text: Text is not SVG - cannot display
